data.title: William T. Deutschendorf and Henry J. Deutschendorf II
data.meta_description: Both William T. Deutschendorf and Henry J. Deutschendorf II (Also known as Will and Hank Deutschendorf) are the baby actors that together played Oscar in Ghostbusters II. That, however, is the only acting role the Deutshendorfs have. When they grew up, the brothers, known as Will and Hank...
data.text:
Both William T. Deutschendorf and Henry J. Deutschendorf II (Also known as Will and Hank Deutschendorf) are the baby actors that together played Oscar in Ghostbusters II. That, however, is the only acting role the Deutshendorfs have.

About[]

When they grew up, the brothers, known as Will and Hank, became martial-arts Instructors for West Coast Martial Arts Academy. Will continues his work with the academy today.[2]

After a long battle with schizoaffective disorder, Hank Deutschendorf died by suicide in an apartment he shared with Will in Escondido. Will started a drive for "Hank's Hope for a Cure" with the Brain & Behavior Research Foundation for those who wish to offer their condolences.[3][4][5]

Trivia[]

Ivan Reitman would often stand in front of Will and Hank and talk to them to get their attention for filming.[6]

About five versions of Oscar's medical examination in Ghostbusters II were filmed.[7]

On page 11 of Ghostbusters 101 #6, the Coming Soon advertisement references Will and Hank Deutschendorf and their career in martial arts.

References[]
